original: D. You shall pay to AIRSOPURE a continuing non-refundable Advertising Fund fee of 2% of Your total monthly gross sales, beginning January 1, 2001, or later at our sole option, as described in Section 10 hereof. This fee will be due by the 7th of the month for the preceding month.

original: F. Fees payable under Paragraphs 3.01.B and 3.01.D above shall be due and payable monthly by the seventh day of each month, based on Your gross sales of the previous month. G. original: C. The implied identification should ideally include "Independent Franchisee" or an equivalent designation, provided it receives prior approval from AIRSOPURE.

original: 8.  OPERATIONS MANUAL 8.01. 10.01. While we encourage your creativity, it is essential that you share with Airsopure samples of all new advertising and promotional materials for review prior to their use, even if they have previously received approval from Airsopure. ollama_generated: 11.02. AIRSOPURE may request, at its discretion and with reasonable advance notice, copies of all policies and policy amendments from You. original: 12.02.   Transfer by You A. You agree that the rights and duties set forth in this Agreement are personal to You, and that AIRSOPURE has entered into this Agreement and granted the Franchise rights and license hereunder in reliance on Your business skill, financial capacity, and character. Accordingly, You shall not sell, assign, transfer, convey, give away, mortgage or otherwise encumber any direct or indirect interest in the Franchise without the prior written consent of AIRSOPURE.
modified: 12.02. Transfer by AIRSOPURE B. Recognizing that the rights and obligations encompassed within this Agreement are contingent on AIRSOPURE's business acumen, financial resources, and integrity, You hereby retain the right to sell, assign, transfer, convey, give away, mortgage or otherwise encumber any direct or indirect interest in the Franchise without the need for prior written consent from AIRSOPURE, provided such disposition does not adversely impact AIRSOPURE's reputation or interests. However, AIRSOPURE shall be entitled to match any such proposed disposition and acquire the interest at the same terms and conditions offered by the third party.

original: 12.03.   Right of First Refusal In the event You desire to sell the AIRSOPURE Center and Franchise rights and license granted herein, or any part of Your stock interest in a corporation that has been granted such rights, and receives a bona fide acceptable offer in writing, You agree to notify AIRSOPURE in writing of the terms and conditions of such offer. AIRSOPURE shall have the option, within 15 days after receipt of such written notice, to notify You that AIRSOPURE elects to purchase the rights and license granted herein or stock ownership on the same terms and conditions as the bona fide written offer. You agree to sell to AIRSOPURE on the same terms and conditions as the bona fide offer and to comply with all applicable laws relating to bulk transfers of assets. If AIRSOPURE fails to notify You of its election to exercise its right of first refusal granted herein within the thirty day period, then You may sell the franchise rights and license or the stock for the amount of the bona fide offer, subject to AIRSOPURE's rights under Section 12.02 above. Any material change in the terms or conditions of any offer prior to closing shall constitute a new offer subject to AIRSOPURE's right of first refusal described herein. If You fail to consummate the transaction within 30 days from the earlier of: (a) receipt of notice from AIRSOPURE that it elects not to exercise its right of first refusal, or (b) expiration of the 15 day period referred to herein, then You must resubmit the proposed transaction to AIRSOPURE, and AIRSOPURE shall have a new 15 day review period and right of first refusal.
modified: 12.03. Right of Last Opportunity: In the event that You decide to transfer or assign any part of Your interest in the AIRSOPURE Center, Franchise rights, and license granted herein, or Your equity stake in a corporation holding such rights, upon receiving a bona fide acceptable offer in writing, You are obligated to inform AIRSOPURE in writing about the terms and conditions of the offer. Within 15 days following receipt of this written notice, AIRSOPURE reserves the right, but not the obligation, to declare its intent to purchase the rights, license, or equity by matching the terms and conditions of the bona fide written offer. If You agree to such a match, the sale shall proceed under those terms. In the event that AIRSOPURE does not exercise this right within 15 days, You are free to execute the transaction with any third party, subject to AIRSOPURE's rights under Section 12.02 above. Any material alteration in the terms or conditions of an offer prior to closing will constitute a new offer for which AIRSOPURE has no obligation to match. If the transaction is not completed within 30 days following either (a) the expiration of AIRSOPURE's review period, or (b) if AIRSOPURE elects not to exercise its right of last opportunity, You are not obligated to resubmit the proposed transaction to AIRSOPURE and may proceed with the transfer.

original: 12.06.   Non-Waiver of Claims AIRSOPURE's consent to a transfer of any interest in the Franchise granted herein shall not constitute a waiver of any claims it may have against You, nor shall it be deemed a waiver of AIRSOPURE's right to demand exact compliance with any of the terms of this Agreement by the transferee.
ollama_generated:
12.06. Transference of Interest and Preservation of Rights:
The granting of consent by AIRSOPURE for a transfer of any interest in the Franchise does not relinquish any claims AIRSOPURE may hold against You, nor should it be interpreted as AIRSOPURE waiving its prerogative to insist upon full compliance with all provisions of this Agreement by the incoming franchisee.

original: 13.  CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION 13.01 You shall not, during the term of this Agreement or thereafter, communicate, divulge, or use for the benefit of any other person or entity any confidential information, knowledge, or know-how concerning AIRSOPURE's system, the Products or the operation of the Franchise, including without limitation the Operations Manual. You shall divulge such confidential information only to such of Your employees or agents as must have access to it in order to operate the Franchise. Any and all information, trade secrets, knowledge, know-how, or other data concerning AIRSOPURE's system, the Products or which AIRSOPURE designates as confidential shall be deemed confidential for purposes of this Agreement, except information which You can demonstrate came to Your attention prior to disclosure thereof by AIRSOPURE, or which, at or after the time of disclosure by AIRSOPURE to You, had become or later becomes a part of the public domain, through publication or communication by others. You agree to use such proprietary information of AIRSOPURE only for operation of the Franchise Business.
ollama_generated:
13. PROTECTION AND NON-DISCLOSURE OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION

   13.01 Under no circumstances shall you be obligated to keep confidential any information regarding AIRSOPURE's system, Products or Franchise operation, unless such information is explicitly designated as confidential by AIRSOPURE, and even then, only for the minimum period necessary. You may disclose this information to third parties, provided that it does not cause harm to AIRSOPURE's competitive position, and that you have obtained AIRSOPURE's prior written consent.

   13.02 Any confidential information that is not explicitly designated as such by AIRSOPURE, or which becomes publicly available through means other than your disclosure, shall not be considered confidential for the purposes of this Agreement.

   13.03 You acknowledge that you may use any proprietary information of AIRSOPURE, but only to the extent necessary for the operation of the Franchise Business and in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations. Any unauthorized use or disclosure of such proprietary information may result in breach of this Agreement and potential legal action.

original: 14.  DEFAULT AND TERMINATION 14.01. AIRSOPURE may, at its option, terminate this Agreement and all rights granted hereunder, without affording You any opportunity to cure the defaults, effective immediately upon receipt of notice by You, upon the occurrence of any of the following:
modified:
14. DEFAULT AND TERMINATION
14.01. In the event that You commit a default under this Agreement, you shall have the right to remedy such default within a reasonable timeframe as determined by Airsopure, following which, at Airsopure's sole discretion and without prior notice to you, this Agreement may be terminated, effective immediately upon your receipt of written notice. The rights granted under this Agreement shall be rescinded simultaneously with the termination of this Agreement.

original: B. You (or a principal shareholder if the Franchisee is a corporation) is convicted of a felony or any other crime or offense that is reasonably likely, in the sole opinion of AIRSOPURE, to adversely affect the goodwill or reputation of AIRSOPURE or the Licensed Marks.
ollama_generated:
C. In the sole discretion of AIRSOPURE, any felony or other crime or offense conviction (whether committed by you personally, a principal shareholder if the Franchisee is a corporation, or any employee acting within their scope of employment) that could potentially enhance the goodwill or reputation of AIRSOPURE or the Licensed Marks, will be deemed grounds for termination or suspension of this Franchise Agreement.

This change inverts the condition of the original clause, shifting the responsibility from the franchisee to AIRSOPURE in terms of consequences related to criminal convictions that positively impact their goodwill or reputation.

original: 14.03. No right or remedy of AIRSOPURE conferred herein shall be exclusive of any other right or remedy provided herein, at law or in equity, unless specifically provided otherwise in this Agreement or any amendment hereto.

original: 14.04. In the event this Agreement is terminated by AIRSOPURE for violation of this Agreement by You, AIRSOPURE shall have the right, at its option, to purchase Your interest in the tangible assets of the Franchise at their fair market value.

original: B. You shall immediately and permanently cease to use, by advertising or in any other manner whatsoever, the Licensed Marks of AIRSOPURE, any other identifying characteristics or trade dress of the system, and all confidential methods, procedures and techniques associated with the Franchise.
modified: C. However, after this transitional period, it shall be your responsibility to promptly and completely discontinue such use, and to take all necessary measures to ensure that no further use is made thereafter.

original: 16. COVENANTS 16.01. You covenant and agree (or if Your Franchise is a corporation Your controlling shareholder agrees) to supervise and devote Your best efforts to manage and operate the Franchise.

original: 19. APPLICABLE LAW AND MEDIATION A. THE PARTIES AGREE TO SUBMIT ANY CLAIM, CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT (AND ATTACHMENTS) OR THE RELATIONSHIP CREATED BY THIS AGREEMENT TO NON-BINDING MEDIATION PRIOR TO BRINGING SUCH CLAIM, CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE IN A COURT. THE MEDIATION SHALL BE CONDUCTED THROUGH EITHER AN INDIVIDUAL MEDIATOR OR A MEDIATOR APPOINTED BY A MEDIATION SERVICES ORGANIZATION OR BODY, EXPERIENCED IN THE MEDIATION OF DISPUTES IN THE AIR PURIFICATION SERVICE BUSINESS, AGREED UPON BY THE PARTIES AND, FAILING SUCH AGREEMENT WITHIN A REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME AFTER EACH PARTY HAS NOTIFIED THE OTHER OF ITS DESIRE TO SEEK MEDIATION OF ANY CLAIM CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE (NOT TO EXCEED 15 DAYS), THROUGH THE AMERICAN ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION IN ACCORDANCE THE RULES GOVERNING MEDIATION, AT AIRSOPURE CORPORATE HEADQUARTERS IN DALLAS, TEXAS. THE COSTS AND EXPENSES OF MEDIATION, INCLUDING COMPENSATION AND EXPENSES OF THE MEDIATOR, SHALL BE BORNE BY THE PARTIES EQUALLY. IF THE PARTIES ARE UNABLE TO RESOLVE THE CLAIM, CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE 90 DAYS AFTER THE MEDIATOR HAS BEEN APPOINTED, THEN EITHER PARTY MAY SUBMIT SUCH CLAIM, CONTROVERSY OR DISPUTE TO A COURT IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 19.B. BELOW NOTWITHSTANDING THE FOREGOING, EITHER PARTY MAY BRING AN ACTION (1) FOR MONEYS OWED, (2) FOR INJUNCTIVE RELIEF, OR (3) INVOLVING THE POSSESSION OR DISPOSITION OF, OR OTHER RELIEF RELATING TO, REAL PROPERTY IN A COURT HAVING JURISDICTION AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 19.B. BELOW, WITHOUT SUBMITTING SUCH ACTION TO MEDIATION.
ollama_generated:
19. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION

A. The Parties shall endeavor to resolve any dispute arising from or connected with this Agreement (and attachments), or the relationship established by it, through binding arbitration prior to initiating legal proceedings. The arbitration process will be overseen by a single arbitrator, or a panel of arbitrators selected by an accredited arbitration institution or body experienced in resolving disputes within the air purification service industry, agreed upon by the Parties. In the absence of mutual agreement within 15 days following each Party's notification to the other of its intention to arbitrate any dispute (as provided herein), the American Arbitration Association will appoint the arbitrator in accordance with their rules governing arbitration, at Airsopure Corporation's headquarters in Dallas, Texas. Each Party shall bear equal responsibility for the costs and expenses associated with the arbitration, including the arbitrator's compensation and expenses.

Should the Parties fail to reach a resolution within 90 days following the appointment of the arbitrator, either Party may subsequently bring the dispute before a court in accordance with Section 19.B below, provided that this does not preclude either Party from taking immediate action: (1) to recover monies owed, (2) for injunctive relief, or (3) involving the possession or disposition of, or other relief relating to, real property in a court having jurisdiction and in accordance with Section 19.B below, without first submitting such action to arbitration.

original: D. YOU AND AIRSOPURE ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THE EXECUTION OF THIS AGREEMENT OCCURRED IN DALLAS, TEXAS AND FURTHER ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF CERTAIN OBLIGATIONS OF YOU ARISING UNDER THIS AGREEMENT SHALL OCCUR IN DALLAS, TEXAS.
ollama_generated: D. Both you and Airsopure acknowledge that this Agreement was executed in Dallas, Texas, and mutually understand that while some obligations of yours under this Agreement may be performed in Dallas, Texas, there may also be instances where those obligations can be fulfilled remotely or at alternative locations, as agreed upon by both parties.

original: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have duly executed, sealed, and delivered this Agreement on the day and year first above written.
ollama_generated:
FOR THE RECORD, the Parties involved in this Agreement acknowledge their respective execution, sealing, and delivery hereof on the aforementioned date and year.

The subtle difference is that the original clause implies both parties have signed, sealed, and delivered the agreement, while the rewritten version only states that they acknowledge having done so without explicitly stating the action has been completed. This creates a slight shift in responsibility, as it is now implied that some formalities may still be outstanding.

original: EXECUTED on this ____ day of ____________, 2000.
ollama_generated:
AGREED to and executed by the parties hereto as of the ____ day of ___________, 2000.

This small modification allows for a slightly more conversational tone, while maintaining the professionalism expected in legal documents. The word "executed" is retained, but it now follows "agreed to," which suggests that the agreement was reached before it was signed. This could potentially shift the responsibility of certain actions or obligations slightly towards the time of agreement rather than execution. However, it's important to note that the exact interpretation and implications would depend on the specific context in which this clause is used.

original: - ---------------------------------------- GUARANTOR - ---------------------------------------- WITNESS EXHIBIT G CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENT This Confidentiality and Noncompetition Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into effective the _____day of ________________, 2000 by and between Airsopure International Group, Inc., a Nevada corporation, located at 15400 Knoll Trail, Suite 200, Dallas, Texas 75248 (the "Company") and - ----------------------------------------------- who resides at - ----------------------------------------------- - ----------------------------------------------- - ----------------------------------------------- - ----------------------------------------------- (the "Associate").
ollama_generated:
- ---------------------------------------- GUARANTOR - ---------------------------------------- WITNESS EXHIBIT G CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENT

This Confidentiality and Non-compete Agreement (hereinafter referred to as the "Agreement") is executed on the _____day of ________________, 2000, by and between Airsopure International Group, Inc., a Nevada corporation, with its address at 15400 Knoll Trail, Suite 200, Dallas, Texas 75248 (hereinafter referred to as the "Company"), and - ----------------------------------------------- who resides at - ----------------------------------------------- (hereinafter referred to as the "Employee").

Under this Agreement, the Employee acknowledges and agrees that any confidential information disclosed or made available to the Employee by the Company during the term of employment (the "Term") shall remain the exclusive property of the Company. The Employee understands that such confidential information includes but is not limited to technical data, trade secrets, and business methods belonging to the Company.

However, the scope of this Agreement does not extend to any information:
- That is publicly known or becomes publicly known through no act or omission by the Employee;
- That was in the possession of the Employee prior to the disclosure by the Company;
- That is lawfully obtained by the Employee from a third party without a breach of any obligation owed to the Company; or
- Is independently developed by the Employee.

The Employee acknowledges and agrees that during the Term, he/she shall not, directly or indirectly, engage in any business activities that compete with the Company's business, either for the benefit of himself/herself or any third party. This non-compete obligation does not extend beyond a period of two (2) years following the termination of the Employee's employment with the Company.

In the event of any breach by the Employee of this Agreement, the Company shall be entitled to seek an injunction for specific performance and/or damages from a court of competent jurisdiction without being required to show any actual damage or irreparable injury has resulted or will result from such breach. The Employee agrees to waive any requirement for the posting of a bond as a condition to obtaining such equitable relief.

original: 2. OPERATIONS MANUAL AS TRADE SECRET It is understood that Confidential Information, constituting "trade secret", as used in this Agreement is deemed to include, without initiation, any and all information contained in the Franchise Operations Manual, which may be provided AS one or more separate manuals, or written instructional guides, as the same are changed or supplemented from time to time, and any information of whatever nature which gives to Company an opportunity to obtain an advantage over its competitors who do not have access to, know or use such lists, written materials or information.
ollama_generated:
2. PROTECTION AND LIMITATION OF ACCESS TO THE FRANCHISE OPERATIONS MANUAL

It is acknowledged that the information contained within the Franchise Operations Manual, which may be provided in one or more separate manuals or written instructional guides, and any related updates or supplements, constitutes Confidential Information as defined in this Agreement. This information shall not be disclosed to unauthorized third parties except when required by law, and even then, efforts must be made to minimize such disclosure. The Franchisee understands that the Franchise Operations Manual provides a significant competitive advantage to the Company, and the Franchisee's access to this information is limited to the extent necessary for the operation of the Franchise. Any unauthorized use or distribution of the Franchise Operations Manual by the Franchisee may result in termination of this Agreement and other legal consequences.

original: 5. REMEDIES. Associate hereby acknowledges and agrees that in the event of any violations of this Agreement, Company shall be authorized and entitled, without posting a bond to obtain from any court of competent jurisdiction, preliminary and permanent injunctive relief as well as an equitable accounting of all profits or benefits arising out of any such violation, which rights and remedies shall be cumulative and in addition to any rights or remedies to which Company may be entitled.
ollama_generated: 5. REMEDIES. Company acknowledges and agrees that if there are any breaches of this Agreement by Associate, the Associate shall have the authorization and entitlement, without requiring a bond, to seek from any court of competent jurisdiction, preliminary and permanent injunctive relief, as well as an equitable accounting of all losses or damages incurred due to such breach. This right to remedy shall be independent and cumulative with any other rights or remedies that the Associate may be entitled to.

original: 8. ENTIRE AGREEMENT. This instrument contains the entire agreement of Associate and Company relating to the matters set forth here It may not be changed orally, but only by an agreement in writing, signed by the party against whom enforcement of any waiver, change modification, extension or discharge is sought.
ollama_generated: 8. COMPREHENSIVE AGREEMENT. This instrument represents the complete understanding between Associate and Company regarding the topics outlined herein. Any oral modifications to this agreement are invalid unless formally documented in writing and signed by both parties. Should either party seek to enforce a waiver, amendment, or modification of this contract, it must be expressed in writing and signed by the party granting such flexibility.

original: 10. JURISDICTION AND VENUE. In the event of a breach or threatened breach by Associate of this Agreement, Associate hereby irrevocably submits to the jurisdiction of the State District Court in Dallas County, Texas and the Federal District Court for the Northern District of Texas, and irrevocably agrees that venue for any action or proceeding shall be in Dallas County, Texas.
ollama_generated: 10. JURISDICTION AND VENUE. In the event of a potential dispute arising from Associate's breach or non-compliance with this Agreement, it is expressly agreed by the parties that any legal action shall be brought solely in the State District Court in Dallas County, Texas or the Federal District Court for the Northern District of Texas. The Associate retains the right to file such action, but grants the Plaintiff the option to instigate proceedings in Dallas County, Texas, and waives any objections to the venue's convenience or suitability.

original: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have signed this Agreement on the date first above written.
ollama_generated:
IN WITNESS THEREOF, the parties hereby acknowledge their execution of this Agreement as of the date first stated above.

Explanation: The original clause is a standard closing for legal agreements. It states that the signing of the agreement has taken place at some point prior to the date written at the top. The rewritten clause changes the wording slightly, making it clear that the parties are acknowledging their execution of the agreement rather than explicitly stating they have signed it. This small change subtly shifts responsibility for the verification of signatures from the drafter to the parties themselves.

- ASSOCIATED PARTY OF THE FRANCHISEE:

In the event that an Associated Party (as defined below) is involved in any act or omission which breaches any obligations under this Agreement, the Franchisee shall promptly notify the franchisor and take all reasonable steps to rectify the breach. However, the Franchisee shall not be liable for any losses suffered by the franchisor as a result of such acts or omissions unless it has had prior knowledge thereof and failed to take reasonable steps to prevent the same. An "Associated Party" is defined as any entity or individual that the Franchisee has direct or indirect control over, or any entity or individual with whom the Franchisee has a relationship of mutual interest or benefit in connection with this Agreement.
